title: Texas Governor’s Policing of Border Pushes Limits of State Power
content: Gov. Greg Abbott brought in razor wire and floating barriers to deter unauthorized migration. The federal government is mounting a legal pushback.

title: A federal judge blocked a Biden administration plan that drastically limited applications for asylum in the U.S.
‘They Shoot Without Stopping’: Where Russia Is on the Attack in Ukraine
content: Along the vast 600-mile front line, Russia is mostly playing defense. In the northeast, it is once again mounting fierce offensive operations.

title: British intelligence warned that Russia’s naval fleet was preparing to enforce a blockade in the Black Sea.
Internet trolls propelled the rise of the Wagner leader Yevgeny Prigozhin. Now some of them are celebrating his fall.
Life Along the Korean DMZ, 70 Years After the Fighting Ended
content: The Korean War Armistice separated the two Koreas and halted the fighting, but not the war itself.

title: The Very Private Life of Melania Trump
content: The former first lady has steered clear of the campaign trail while her husband fights to return to the White House and faces increasing legal peril.

title: Prosecutors Follow Multiple Strands as Jan. 6 Indictment Decision Looms
content: The special counsel continues to push ahead as he assembles evidence about former President Trump’s efforts to retain power after the 2020 election.

title: A Republican group that opposes Donald Trump has a new ad campaign featuring voters who grew disillusioned with him.
How George Santos Used Political Connections to Fuel Get-Rich Schemes
content: Mr. Santos, the first-term House member under federal indictment, tried to use his candidacy and ties to G.O.P. donors to create moneymaking opportunities.

title: Blistering Heat Spreads to U.S. Midwest as Wildfire Smoke Lingers
content: Midwestern residents sweltered in the heat wave that has scorched the South and Southwest for many days.

title: See photos of the deadly blazes raging across southern Europe and North Africa.
Wildfires in Algeria left 34 people dead, including 10 soldiers who were trying to rescue people, the government said.
Credit Markets Are Creaking, Creating Economic Uncertainty
content: Analysts are warning that bankruptcies and defaults among companies could jump as the world adjusts to higher interest rates.

title: The Federal Reserve is widely expected to raise interest rates at its meeting today. Here’s what to watch for.
Hunter Biden to Appear in Federal Court to Ratify Plea Deal
content: The president’s son is scheduled to plead guilty to two misdemeanor tax charges and accept an agreement that would avert prosecution on a gun charge.

title: Speaker Kevin McCarthy, feeling pressure from the right, has escalated talk of impeaching President Biden.
Women’s World Cup: Spain and Japan Advance to Round of 16; Canada Plays Ireland
content: Japan and Spain turned in statement wins as they headed to a showdown next week. Canada faces Ireland in search of goals, and momentum.

title: Why I’m Rooting for Haiti
content: Among the largest field of competitors in this tournament’s history, the Haitian team may be the scrappiest of them all, our columnist writes.

title: U.S.-Netherlands is a rematch of the 2019 final. But both teams have undergone big changes since then.
Biden Administration Escalates Legacy Debate With Harvard Inquiry
content: An inquiry into admissions preference for family of alumni and donors began after the Supreme Court’s decision last month limiting affirmative action.

title: Hollywood Strike Leaves Influencers Sidelined and Confused
content: Despite not being in the actors’ union, many content creators are passing up deals to promote films or TV shows, fearing a backlash.

title: What ‘The Bear’ Gets Right About Chicago
content: The show celebrates a kind of ambition — humane and independent — that’s often neglected by Hollywood. Maybe that’s why the setting is so important.

title: A Commitment to Green Policy in Britain Is Tested by an Election Win
content: The Conservative Party kept a seat by opposing some penalties on older, more-polluting cars, raising questions about its own pledges to reduce emissions.

title: Family Died in Rockies After Trying to Live ‘Off the Grid,’ Official Says
content: Two sisters and a teenage son moved to a Colorado campsite last July. They had wanted a break from a world that distressed them, a local coroner said.

title: The Prize for the Longest Pregnancy in Mammals May Go to This Whale
content: Bowhead whales may carry their babies for as long as 23 months, although more research is needed to confirm the finding.

title: Judge Vacates Bowe Bergdahl’s Conviction and Dishonorable Discharge
content: The Army colonel overseeing the court-martial trial had applied for a job with the Trump-era Justice Department, raising the appearance of bias.

title: The Wind, the Water, the Islands: Exploring Stockholm’s Archipelago
content: With more than 20,000 islands, the archipelago is a quintessential summer destination for Swedes. Travelers can explore it, too, by ferry and rented boat.

content: This Goth king nurtured Roman culture and impressed Machiavelli.

content: A ’90s revival is missing that era’s swaggering sense of national self-belief.

content: Kylian Mbappé is the target of a huge offer from a Saudi Arabian club, but he isn’t ready to leave yet.

title: Michigan’s Penalty for Football Coach Is an Appropriate Slap on the Wrist
content: Jim Harbaugh faces a suspension of four inconsequential games, and that’s a sign of progress on N.C.A.A.’s outdated rules, our columnist writes.
